item.title: TPMS modeling with Matlab (rectified)
item.description:
1.Solid Shell generation

clear all; 
close all; 
clc;

% Derek's User Design Inputs
cs = 10; % TPMS Cell Size in mm (Dimensional Length of a Unit Cell)
cd_w = 8; % Cell Density through Build Width (Number of Cells through the Build Width)
cd_h = 8; % Cell Density through Build Height (Number of Cells through the Build Height)
t = 0.8; % TPMS Surface Thickness in mm (Sheet Thickness of the Generated Lattice)
f = 20; % Cell Fineness Parameter (Number of Divisions within a Unit Cell.% Calculations
hs = cs/2; % Half Cell Size in mm
w = cs*cd_w; % Overall Build Width in mm
hw = w/2; % Build Half-Width in mm
h = cs*cd_h; % Overall Build Height in mm
ht = t/2; % Half Thickness of Lattice Sheet
m = pi/hs; % Periodicity Multiplier
% Design Space Range
xl = -hw; xu = hw;
yl = -hw; yu = hw;
zl = -hw; zu = hw;
% Design Space Range to Grid
x = [xl:cs/f:xu];
y = [yl:cs/f:yu];
z = [zl:cs/f:zu];
% Design Space Grid
[X,Y,Z] = meshgrid(x,y,z);

% Gyroid Surface Function
GMS = @(x,y,z) sin(m*x/2).*cos(m*y/2) + sin(m*y/2).*cos(m*z/2) + sin(m*z/2).*cos(m*x/2);
% Trigonometric Representation
F = GMS(X,Y,Z); % Function Evaluation
stlname = ['G_solid.stl']; % File name

% Generate neutral Surface based on Chosen TPMS Design
Surf = isosurface(x,y,z,F,0);

boundary_indices = boundary(Surf.vertices(:,1), Surf.vertices(:,2), Surf.vertices(:,3));
% Create Offsets for Desired Thickness based on Surface Normals
SNorms = isonormals(x,y,z,F,Surf.vertices); % Surface Normals at Vertices
SNunit = SNorms./vecnorm(SNorms,2,2); % Surface Unit Normals at Vertices
OSoffset = Surf.vertices + ht*SNunit; % Outer Surface Offset
ISoffset = Surf.vertices - ht*SNunit; % Inner Surface Offset
OSoffset(boundary_indices, 1) = min(max(OSoffset(boundary_indices, 1), xl), xu);
OSoffset(boundary_indices, 2) = min(max(OSoffset(boundary_indices, 2), yl), yu);
OSoffset(boundary_indices, 3) = min(max(OSoffset(boundary_indices, 3), zl), zu);
ISoffset(boundary_indices, 1) = min(max(ISoffset(boundary_indices, 1), xl), xu);
ISoffset(boundary_indices, 2) = min(max(ISoffset(boundary_indices, 2), yl), yu);
ISoffset(boundary_indices, 3) = min(max(ISoffset(boundary_indices, 3), zl), zu);

% Find Free Boundary Surfaces in order to Close Lattice Surface
TRfb = triangulation([Surf.faces; Surf.faces + max(max(Surf.faces))],[ISoffset;
OSoffset]); % Inner & Outer Surface Triangulation
FB = freeBoundary(TRfb); % Surface Free Boundaries
% Enclose Openings Between Inner and Outer Surfaces
FBtr = FB; % Surface Free Boundary Index
hFB = length(FB)/2; % Half of the Free Boundary Index
FBtr(1:hFB,3) = FB(hFB+1:end,1); % Inner Surface to Outer Surface Triangulation
FBtr(hFB+1:end,3) = FBtr(1:hFB,2); % Outer Surface to Inner Surface Triangulation
n = FBtr(1:hFB, :); 
FBtr(1:hFB, :) = n(:, [1, 3, 2]);  
% Combine Surfaces Arrays into Single Array for Triangulation
sVerts = [ISoffset; OSoffset]; % Inner and Outer Surface Vertices
sFaces = [Surf.faces; Surf.faces + max(max(Surf.faces))]; % Inner and Outer Surfaces Faces
sFaces(size(Surf.faces,1)+1:2*size(Surf.faces,1), :) = fliplr(sFaces(size(Surf.faces,1)+1:2*size(Surf.faces,1), :));
sFull = [sFaces; FBtr]; % Add Boundaries

% Triangulation of Build for .stl Output
TR = triangulation(sFull,sVerts);


stlwrite(TR,stlname);

The keys are :

item.title: TPMS simulation using Dynamic/Explicit
item.description:
1.Initial simulation settings

its results down here

still got some questions: why they got zero Poisson’s Ratio instead of Postive Poisson’s Ratio

Despite its wrong density and step period ,the results can be partly resonable according to its consistent settings (regardless of ALLKE/ALLIE>5%).

1.Rectified simulation settings

As for its tiny time period, it’s according to

1.Why don’t we do that:

If consistnet with experimental time period, its total time increments will a be mega number, for its critical time increment is tiny near micron-scale, it cost a lot even the collapse of the sys.

item.title: TPMS periodic array generation method using MATLAB
item.description:
1.Solid Shell generation

clear all; 
close all; 
clc;

% Derek's User Design Inputs
cs = 10; % TPMS Cell Size in mm (Dimensional Length of a Unit Cell)
cd_w = 8; % Cell Density through Build Width (Number of Cells through the Build Width)
cd_h = 8; % Cell Density through Build Height (Number of Cells through the Build Height)
t = 1; % TPMS Surface Thickness in mm (Sheet Thickness of the Generated Lattice)
f = 20; % Cell Fineness Parameter (Number of Divisions within a Unit Cell.% Calculations
hs = cs/2; % Half Cell Size in mm
w = cs*cd_w; % Overall Build Width in mm
hw = w/2; % Build Half-Width in mm
h = cs*cd_h; % Overall Build Height in mm
ht = t/2; % Half Thickness of Lattice Sheet
m = pi/hs; % Periodicity Multiplier
% Design Space Range
xl = -hw; xu = hw;
yl = -hw; yu = hw;
zl = -hw; zu = hw;
% Design Space Range to Grid
x = [xl:cs/f:xu];
y = [yl:cs/f:yu];
z = [zl:cs/f:zu];
% Design Space Grid
[X,Y,Z] = meshgrid(x,y,z);

% Primitive Surface Function
PMS = @(x,y,z) cos(m*x) + cos(m*y) + cos(m*z); % Trigonometric Representation
F = PMS(X,Y,Z); % Function Evaluation
stlname = ['P_build.stl']; % File name
% Diamond Surface Function
DMS = @(x,y,z) sin(m*x/2).*sin(m*y/2).*sin(m*z/2) + sin(m*x/2).*cos(m*y/2).*cos(m*z/2) +
cos(m*x/2).*sin(m*y/2).*cos(m*z/2) + cos(m*x/2).*cos(m*y/2).*sin(m*z/2); % Trigonometric
Representation
F = DMS(X,Y,Z); % Function Evaluation
stlname = ['D_build.stl']; % File name
% I-WP Surface Function
IMS = @(x,y,z) 2*(cos(m*x).*cos(m*y) + cos(m*y).*cos(m*z) + cos(m*z).*cos(m*x)) -
cos(2*m*x).*cos(2*m*y).*cos(2*m*z); % Trigonometric Representation
F = IMS(X,Y,Z); % Function Evaluation
stlname = ['I_build.stl']; % File name

% Gyroid Surface Function
GMS = @(x,y,z) sin(m*x/2).*cos(m*y/2) + sin(m*y/2).*cos(m*z/2) + sin(m*z/2).*cos(m*x/2);
% Trigonometric Representation
F = GMS(X,Y,Z); % Function Evaluation
stlname = ['G_build.stl']; % File name

% Generate neutral Surface based on Chosen TPMS Design
Surf = isosurface(x,y,z,F,0);
% Create Offsets for Desired Thickness based on Surface Normals
SNorms = isonormals(x,y,z,F,Surf.vertices); % Surface Normals at Vertices
SNunit = SNorms./vecnorm(SNorms,2,2); % Surface Unit Normals at Vertices
OSoffset = Surf.vertices + ht*SNunit; % Outer Surface Offset
ISoffset = Surf.vertices - ht*SNunit; % Inner Surface Offset
% Find Free Boundary Surfaces in order to Close Lattice Surface
TRfb = triangulation([Surf.faces; Surf.faces + max(max(Surf.faces))],[ISoffset;
OSoffset]); % Inner & Outer Surface Triangulation
FB = freeBoundary(TRfb); % Surface Free Boundaries
% Enclose Openings Between Inner and Outer Surfaces
FBtr = FB; % Surface Free Boundary Index
hFB = length(FB)/2; % Half of the Free Boundary Index
FBtr(1:hFB,3) = FB(hFB+1:end,1); % Inner Surface to Outer Surface Triangulation
FBtr(hFB+1:end,3) = FBtr(1:hFB,2); % Outer Surface to Inner Surface Triangulation
% Combine Surfaces Arrays into Single Array for Triangulation
sVerts = [ISoffset; OSoffset]; % Inner and Outer Surface Vertices
sFaces = [Surf.faces; Surf.faces + max(max(Surf.faces))]; % Inner and Outer Surfaces Faces
sFull = [sFaces; FBtr]; % Add Boundaries

% Triangulation of Build for .stl Output
TR = triangulation(sFull,sVerts);

stlwrite(TR,stlname);

2.Sandwich Shell generation

clear all; 
close all; 
clc;

% Derek's User Design Inputs
cs = 10; % TPMS Cell Size in mm (Dimensional Length of a Unit Cell)
cd_w = 8; % Cell Density through Build Width (Number of Cells through the Build Width)
cd_h = 8; % Cell Density through Build Height (Number of Cells through the Build Height)
t_tot = 2.6; % TPMS Surface Thickness in mm (Sheet Thickness of the Generated Lattice)
t_core= 1 ;
f = 15; % Cell Fineness Parameter (Number of Divisions within a Unit Cell.% Calculations
hs = cs/2; % Half Cell Size in mm
w = cs*cd_w; % Overall Build Width in mm
hw = w/2; % Build Half-Width in mm
h = cs*cd_h; % Overall Build Height in mm
ht_tot = t_tot/2; % Half Thickness of Lattice Sheet
ht_core= t_core/2;
m = pi/hs; % Periodicity Multiplier
% Design Space Range
xl = -hw; xu = hw;
yl = -hw; yu = hw;
zl = -hw; zu = hw;
% Design Space Range to Grid
x = [xl:cs/f:xu];
y = [yl:cs/f:yu];
z = [zl:cs/f:zu];
% Design Space Grid
[X,Y,Z] = meshgrid(x,y,z);

% Gyroid Surface Function
GMS = @(x,y,z) sin(m*x/2).*cos(m*y/2) + sin(m*y/2).*cos(m*z/2) + sin(m*z/2).*cos(m*x/2);
% Trigonometric Representation
F = GMS(X,Y,Z); % Function Evaluation
stlname = ['G_build1.stl']; % File name

% Generate neutral Surface based on Chosen TPMS Design
Surf = isosurface(x,y,z,F,0);
% Create Offsets for Desired Thickness based on Surface Normals
SNorms = isonormals(x,y,z,F,Surf.vertices); % Surface Normals at Vertices
SNunit = SNorms./vecnorm(SNorms,2,2); % Surface Unit Normals at Vertices
OSoffset = Surf.vertices + ht_tot*SNunit; % Outer Surface Offset
Soffset1 = Surf.vertices + ht_core*SNunit;
Soffset2 = Surf.vertices - ht_core*SNunit;
ISoffset = Surf.vertices - ht_tot*SNunit; % Inner Surface Offset
% Find Free Boundary Surfaces in order to Close Lattice Surface
TRfb = triangulation([Surf.faces; Surf.faces + max(max(Surf.faces)); Surf.faces + 2*max(max(Surf.faces)); Surf.faces + 3*max(max(Surf.faces))],[ISoffset;Soffset2;Soffset1;OSoffset]); % Inner & Outer Surface Triangulation
FB = freeBoundary(TRfb); % Surface Free Boundaries
% Enclose Openings Between Inner and Outer Surfaces
FBtr = FB; % Surface Free Boundary Index
qFB = length(FB)/4; % Half of the Free Boundary Index
FBtr(1:qFB,3) = FB(qFB+1:2*qFB,1);
FBtr(qFB+1:2*qFB,3) = FB(1:qFB,2); 
FBtr(2*qFB+1:3*qFB,3) = FB(3*qFB+1:end,1);
FBtr(3*qFB+1:end,3) = FB(2*qFB+1:3*qFB,2); 

% Combine Surfaces Arrays into Single Array for Triangulation
sVerts = [ISoffset;Soffset2;Soffset1; OSoffset]; 
sFaces = [Surf.faces; Surf.faces + max(max(Surf.faces)); Surf.faces + 2*max(max(Surf.faces)); Surf.faces + 3*max(max(Surf.faces))];
sFull = [sFaces; FBtr]; % Add Boundaries

% Triangulation of Build for .stl Output
TR = triangulation(sFull,sVerts);

stlwrite(TR,stlname);

item.title: TPMS periodic single-cell integration simulation
item.description:
1.(mathematica)

https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/J1FIr99urkgp4c92-9rIRA

  1. Gyroid

sin(x) cos(y) + sin(y) cos(z) + sin(z) cos(x)

  1. Schwarz (Primitive)

cos(x)+cos(y)+cos(z)

  1. Diamond

sin(x)*sin(y)*sin(z)+sin(x)*cos(y)*cos(z)+cos(x)*sin(y)*cos(z)+cos(x)*cos(y)*sin(z)

  1. Lidinoid

sin(2x) * cos(y) * sin(z) + sin(2y) * cos(z) * sin(x) + sin(2z) * cos(x) * sin(y) - cos(2x) * cos(2y) - cos(2y) * cos(2z) - cos(2z) * cos(2*x) + 0.3

  1. Split P

1.1*(sin(2x)sin(z)cos(y)+sin(2y)sin(x)cos(z)+sin(2z)sin(y)cos(x)) -0.2(cos(2x)cos(2y)+cos(2y)cos(2z)+cos(2z)cos(2x))-0.4(cos(2x) + cos(2y) +cos(2*z))

  1. Neovius

3*(cos(x)+cos(y)+cos(z))+4*cos(x)*cos(y)*cos(z)

  1. IWP

2 (Cos[Pi/10 x] Cos[Pi/10 y] + Cos[Pi/10 y] Cos[Pi/10 z] + Cos[Pi/10 z] Cos[Pi/10 x]) - (Cos[Pi/5 x] + Cos[Pi/5 y] +Cos[Pi/5 z])

item.title: My original intention for building a BLOG
item.description:
I don’t intend to be famous or what , I will definitely public all my stuffs on CSDN or Bilibili if I want to do so. So, I build my personal web basicly for recording beacause there is no site that contains all mixed blogs better than you own web.

But more importantly, it is an essay ,more accurately , a “recruitment ad” that inspired me for doing this website , and I highly recommend all “lost” or ambitious college students to read this one, for its enlightening me to do more meaningful things rather than pure rat race.

item.title: Universal PBC node-Matching abaqus script
item.description:
Traits

Specially designed for TPMS

  1. Automatically adapt to the constraint type of dian/bian/mian,
  2. no need to manually select set REALIZE THE AUTOMATION OF MIAN, DIAN, AND BIAN SETTINGS
  3. Solid/shell type support is supported in cases
  4. faces, edges, and points can be incomplete
#--------------------------------------------------------------------------
#--------------------Applying the periodic boundary conditions-------------
#The script is run in the Abaqus CAE interface not command
#Tol parameter should be smaller than the element size.
#Input file of Abaqus should be provided to the script
#Notice that Partname/instancename/node sets should be assigned with the 
#following indicated name, e.g. Part-1,Part1-1,MIANX
#Make sure that the model with vertices have one of them on the corner
#-----------------Written by Guodong Fang, 12/03/2015, in Bristol----------
#-------------Modified by Yuqin Xiao ,10/24/2024 ,in ZheJiang--------------
#--------------------------------------------------------------------------
#-----------Contact me for the source code---------------------------------

Theory

pending
